intro: Phyteuma michelii subsp. betonicifolium, commonly known as the betonicifolium phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The leaves are typically lanceolate and have a rough texture, while the flowers are usually blue or purple in color. This plant prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
